raw_text:
Sprinter Walker quits athletics
 
 Former European 200m champion Dougie Walker is to retire from athletics after a series of six operations left him struggling for fitness.
 
 Walker had hoped to compete in the New Year Sprint which is staged at Musselburgh Racecourse near Edinburgh on Tuesday and Wednesday. The 31-year-old Scot was suspended for two years in 1998 after testing positive for nandrolone. "I had intended to race but I'm running like a goon," said Walker. He told the Herald newspaper: "I'm not in great shape, after missing about a month of training. "I missed a big chunk of speed work over about three weeks, and then another week working in America. "If I'd had a half-decent mark it might have motivated me more, but I won't be racing. "I still enjoy training, but feel it's time to move on, and concentrate on a career."
llama3.2:1b: Dougie Walker, former European 200m champion, has announced his retirement from athletics after suffering six operations that left him struggling for fitness. He plans to compete in the New Year Sprint at Musselburgh Racecourse near Edinburgh.
llama3.2:3b: Former European 200m champion Dougie Walker is retiring from athletics after six operations left him struggling for fitness. He had planned to compete in the New Year Sprint, but will instead focus on his career.
gemma2:2b: Dougie Walker is retiring from athletics after six surgeries left him unfit.  He was suspended for two years in 1998 for testing positive for nandrolone and hoped to compete at the New Year Sprint. Walker feels he's not in good shape and will focus on a career instead of racing.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Dougie Walker, European 200m champion, quits athletics after six operations leading to fitness struggles.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Walker retires from athletics after six operations impairing fitness; hopes to compete in New Year Sprint cancelled due to injury.
qwen2.5:3b: Former European 200m champion Dougie Walker is retiring from athletics due to six operations causing him fitness issues. He was initially set to compete in the New Year Sprint at Musselburgh Racecourse but has decided not to race as he's not in good shape, having missed significant training periods. At 31, Walker intends to focus on a career rather than continuing his athletic career.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so the user has given me this query where they want me to summarize a text about Dougie Walker quitting athletics. They provided both the original text and their example summary, which I can study.

First, I need to understand the main points of the original text. The key details are that Dougie Walker is an athlete who was a European 200m champion, but he's retiring after undergoing six operations and struggling for fitness. He was supposed to compete in the New Year Sprint at Musselburgh Racecourse on Tuesday and Wednesday.

I notice that the user wants only the summary in plain text without any explanations or formatting. So I have to ensure my summary captures all important aspects like his intention, why he's retiring, the reasons for his health issues, and his feelings about it.

I should make sure not to mention the suspension because that's more detailed than necessary for a concise summary. Also, the user wants no reasoning process, so I can't add any interpretations or explanations beyond what's given in their example.

Putting it all together, my summary should reflect his intention, the circumstances causing him to retire, his reasons for not racing, and his adjustment towards focusing on a career instead of performance.
</think>

Dougie Walker intends to compete in the New Year Sprint at Musselburgh Racecourse but has decided to retire after undergoing six operations and struggling for fitness.
tinyllama:1.1b: Former European 200m champion Dougie Walker, who is known for his exceptional running performances, has announced that he will retire from athletics after suffering several operations left him struggling for fitness. The athlete was suspended for two years in 1998 for violating the World Anti-Doping Agency's Code following a failed drug test. Walker, who turned 31 on November 20th, told local newspaper The Herald that he was unable to train properly due to his recent health issues, which include missing about a month of speed work and spending three weeks in the United States working on a project. If he had a good mark, Walker would have been motivated more, but he still enjoys training, but felt it was time to focus on a career instead of athletics.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Former European 200m champion Dougie Walker announced his retirement from athletics after going through several surgeries due to his struggle with fitness and a suspension for testing positive for nandrolone. He intends to focus on a career in professional wrestling instead.

He will not compete in the upcoming New Year Sprint event at Musselburgh Racecourse near Edinburgh. Walker was suspended two years ago for testing positive for nandrolone, but still enjoys training and plans to focus on a new career.

The former European 200m champion said he felt it's time to move on and concentrate on a career.

However, Walker stated that he is not in great shape and has missed significant training time, ultimately deciding to focus on a career outside of athletics.
stablelm2:1.6b: Ex-Champ Dougie Walker retiring due to numerous surgeries leaving him unfit for competition after serving a two-year suspension in 2018. He planned to participate in the New Year Sprint at Musselburgh Racecourse but decided against it following his poor fitness levels. Walker, who served as a European champion, missed significant training time before and during an American trip due to health issues. Despite retirement, he still maintains interest in athletics and hopes for future endeavors.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Dougie Walker, a 31-year-old former European 200m champion who tested positive for performance-enhancing drugs in 1998, has decided to retire from athletics due to persistent fitness issues following six surgeries. Despite his suspension being lifted and the upcoming New Year Sprint at Musselburgh Racecourse, Walker stated he's not in optimal condition, having missed significant training sessions and speed work. He expressed enjoyment in training but felt it was time to focus on other pursuits, citing this decision as a result of his deteriorating fitness.
